com.engineersbox.httpproxy.connection.stream

Class CRLFRetentiveLineReader

  • java.lang.Object
    • com.engineersbox.httpproxy.connection.stream.CRLFRetentiveLineReader

  • public class CRLFRetentiveLineReader
extends java.lang.Object
    Stream reader that can reads a line, terminating on any termination configuration of CR (\r) and/or LF (\n), retaining the termination in the read line string and raw bytes

    • Constructor Summary

      Constructors 
      Constructor and Description
      CRLFRetentiveLineReader(java.io.InputStream stream) 

    • Method Summary

      All Methods Instance Methods Concrete Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      <any> readLineBytes()
      Reads byte-by-byte from InputStream until it finds one of 3 line termination configurations: CR (\r) LF (\n) CRLF (\r\n) Once a line terminator has been reached it terminates the read and returns.

      • Methods inherited from class java.lang.Object

        clone, equals, finalize, getClass, hashCode, notify, notifyAll, toString, wait, wait, wait

    • Constructor Detail

      • CRLFRetentiveLineReader

        public CRLFRetentiveLineReader(java.io.InputStream stream)

    • Method Detail

      • readLineBytes

        public <any> readLineBytes()
                    throws java.io.IOException
        Reads byte-by-byte from InputStream until it finds one of 3 line termination configurations:
        1. CR (\r)
        2. LF (\n)
        3. CRLF (\r\n)
        Once a line terminator has been reached it terminates the read and returns. The read line INCLUDES the line terminator in the string and byte list. Each line read stores the resulting string and the raw bytes as a List<<Byte>>, returned as a Pair<String, List<Byte>>.

        This method exists to handle the issues with reading compressed data with a BufferedReader, in that line reads have their terminators omitted from the returned string, which can malform/corrupt compressed body data.

        Additionally, it is not possible to reconstruct these line endings as there is no way to tell which one of the three possible endings was encountered
        Returns:
        org.apache.commons.lang3.tuple.Pair with the String version of a read line and List containing raw Byte of the line read.
        Throws:
        java.io.IOException - If an I/O error occurs

        This method is based around an implementation by a user pts in this StackOverflow post
